wikipedia_page.main: Lawrence Whiteside "Laurie" Williams (born 16 November 1948) was a Scottish footballer who played for Dumbarton and Morton. He also had brief loan spells with Motherwell and Dundee.

response: *Laurie Williams (wheelchair basketball) (born 1992), British female wheelchair basketball player
Laurie Williams v Hearts on 26 August.
* The League match against Airdrie on 6 December marked Laurie Williams's 200th appearance for Dumbarton in all national competitions - the 13th Dumbarton player to break the 'double century'.
* The League match against Hamilton on 25 February marked Laurie Williams's 300th appearance for Dumbarton in all national competitions - the 5th Dumbarton player to achieve this accolade.

Finally, Laurie Williams was given a testimonial for his 10 years of service to the club, and he captained Dumbarton against a Scottish League Select - the result being a 1-1 draw with Williams himself scoring the equalising penalty for Dumbarton.
